cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 mi SSE of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, with the forecast track bringing the center ashore between Port Mansfield and San Luis Pass (near Corpus Christi/Rockport area) late Friday and then stalling inland.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi–Rockport–Port O’Connor
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (core expected to remain inland through the 5-day period)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: north of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass; Storm Surge Watch: Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (10–15 in. with isolated 20 in. forecast for middle TX coast)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (forecast surge 4–6 ft Port Mansfield to High Island)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) possible by early Friday; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if Harvey intensifies before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft inundation possible along the Corpus Christi bayfront and barrier islands if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated 20 inches possible, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Thursday night; potential prolonged flooding if the system stalls inland.
